alert.note: Alert for Clarke (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:53PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Choctaw and north central Clarke Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 452 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 6 miles west of Putnam, or 7 miles southeast of Butler, moving east at 40 mph. Another strong storm over Clarke county Mississippi will move into portions of western Choctaw county within the hour. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Butler and Toxey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
